intro: Enterospermum gracile, commonly known as the slender enterosperm, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. It typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. Enterospermum gracile is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and scrublands.
